newsitem.title: USA: Deere posts record profit for quarter.
newsitem.headline: Deere posts record profit for quarter.

text.p: Deere & Co., the world's largest farm equipment maker, Tuesday reported record earnings for the latest quarter, thanks to a 3 percent gain in revenues.

The Moline, Ill.-based company said it earned $176.8 million, or 69 cents a share, in its fiscal first quarter, which ended Jan. 31. That compared with year earlier earnings of $166.2 million, or 63 cents a share. Sales rose to $2.39 billion from $2.31 billion.
"The higher profits resulted from strong worldwide retail demand for the company's products, especially new tractors and combines," said Chairman Hans W. Becherer.
"The company's first quarter sales and revenues were in line with our expectations and provide a solid base for strong full-year sales activity," he said.
"The remainder of 1997 should benefit from a moderately growing domestic economy, healthy agricultural markets and generally high levels of farmer confidence," Becherer said.
Deere said its worldwide sales of agricultural, industrial, and commercial and consumer equipment totalled $2.003 billion for the quarter compared with $1.937 billion a year earlier.
Export sales from the United States increased to $392 million during the quarter from $308 million a year earlier due to stronger sales to the former Soviet Union.
The results at Deere's financial services unit dropped to $43.3 million from $48.7 million.
Deere's stock was up 62.5 cents at $42.125 on the New York Stock Exchange.
